sen.j: 傀儡子（くぐつ、傀儡とも言う）とは、9世紀頃から各資料に現れだした、諸国を旅し、芸能によって生計を営んでいた集団の事である。
sen.e: Kugutsu is a group of people who traveled across the nation and made a living by performing arts, appearing on the records from around the nineth century.
Kugutsu were groups of people who traveled around the country and made a living in the performing arts, appearing on the records from around the 9th century.
Kugutsu were groups of people who traveled around the country and made a living in the performing arts, appearing on the records from around the ninth century.
sen.cmt: スペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 呪術等を用い、色々な芸能を行うことが出来、また特に人形を操っていたとされる。
sen.e: They are said to have been able to make various performances, and especially, to have maneuvered puppets, using magic.
They are said to have used magic to conduct various performances, particularly the control of puppets.
sen.cmt: Retranslated to reflect the source text.
sen.e: They are said to have used magic to conduct various performances, particularly the control of puppets.

sen.j: 傀儡師とも書き、女性の場合は傀儡女（くぐつめ）ともいう。
sen.e: Kugutsu can be written in a different form of Kanji and the females were called Kugutsume.
They were also referred to as 'Kugutsushi' and females were called 'kugutsume,'
sen.cmt: Retranslated to reflect the source text.
sen.e: They were also written as kugutsushi (傀儡師) and females were called 'kugutsume.'

sen.j: その生活体系から、後の時代の、巫女、歌舞伎、市子、イタコ等との関連性が指摘されている。
sen.e: Given their way of living, their relevance with subsequent Miko (ladies serving the god), Kabuki (Japanese drama play), Ichigo(psychic ladies) and Itako(ladies with special religious ability) has been pointed out.
Due to their livelihood, their relationship to subsequent groups such as miko (shrine maidens), kabuki (Japanese classical drama) performers and ichigo (female fortune-tellers) has been identified.
